required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Viscosity of a Vaginal Moisturizer
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Perceived Effectiveness to Evaluate Viscosity of a Vaginal Moisturizer in Menopaused Women

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the perception of viscosity of a vaginal moisturizer in postmenopausal women

detailed_description.textblock:
A unicentric, blind, non-comparative clinical study to prove the perceived efficacy of the research product.
It will be necessary 33 female research participants, aged between 45 and 70 years menopause with complaint of vaginal dryness.
The participant will remain in the study for one day, making use of the research product in the Research Center.
Participants will be divided into 2 groups so that each group observes the viscosity (flow) of the test product in a different anatomical position (lying down and standing) immediately after application of the product, after 15 and 30 minutes.
Participants will respond to a subjective assessment using a standardized questionnaire to capture possible feelings of discomfort during the study.
A gynecologist will be available to monitor the participants throughout the study.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate subjectively the perceived viscosity change
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after application, 15 and 30 minutes after application
primary_outcome.description: Perceived viscosity change of the research product from the point of view of the target public under normal conditions of use through a questionnaire

arm_group.description: After application of the product (sodium lactate and combination of polymers) will remain standing for 30 minutes
After application of the product (sodium lactate and combination of polymers) remained lying down with the legs stretched for 30 minutes;

intervention.intervention_name: sodium lactate and combination of polymers
intervention.description: sodium lactate and combination of polymers (polycarbophil, carbomer and PVM / MA copolymer)
